did.unittitle:
Aldred Scott Warthin pamphlets and reprints
1909-1929

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The provenance of these material is unknown.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transfered to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Aldred Scott Warthin pamphlets and reprints, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Aldred Scott Warthin was a pathologist and professor of pathology at the University of Michigan.

scopecontent.p: This collection of Aldred Scott Warthin pamphlets and reprints was accumulated from different sources. It has been arranged alphabetically by title.

did.unittitle: Pamphlets and reprints

A biologic philosophy or religion a necessary foundation for race betterment, undated
Cactus-spine pseudotubercles, 1924
Cardiovascular syphilis, 1927
The constitutional entity of exopthalmic goiter and so-called toxic adenoma, 1928
The differential diagnosis of chancre and carcinoma of the cervix, 1921
The effect of roentgen rays on the heart: I. The microscopic changes in the heart muscle of rats and rabbits following a single exposure, 1927
The effect of roentgen rays on the heart: II. The microscopic changes in the heart muscle of rats and rabbits following a series of exposures, 1929
The excretion of spirochaeta pallida. through the kidneys, 1922
An experimental investigation as to the possible etiologic relationship of monilia psilosis to pernicious anemia, 1927
Hyperthropy of the hemolymph nodes in Texas-fever imaunes, 1923
Increasing human incidence of broad tapeworm infestation in Great Lakes region, 1928
John George Adami: an appreciation, 1929
Lesions of latent syphilis, 1929
Marcello Malpighi, 1628-1694, 1929
The medical library of the University of Michigan, 1917
Medical observations in Hawaii, 1928
The molasses plate method for the staining of many paraffin sections at one time, 1924
The myocardial lesions of diphtheria, 1924
Noah Webster as epidemiologist, 1923
The occurrence of entamoeba histolytica with tissue lesions in the testis and epididymis in chronic dysentery, 1922
The occurrence of hepatic lesions in patients treated by intensive deep roentgen irradiation, 1924
Osler and the International Association of Medical Museums, 1927
The pathology of the aging process, 1928
The pathology of the skin lesions produced by mustard gas (dichlorethylsulphide), 1918
The physical health of the University, 1909
Pigmentation of the skin (Addison's disease) associated with lymphosarcoma, 1924
A preliminary report on the cerebral pathology of human botulism resulting from canned spinach, 1922
President's address: The nature of cancer susceptibility in human families, 1928
Recreations for physicians, 1926
The relation of cancer of the stomach to ulcers, 1927
The relation of diet to pernicious anemia, 1926
Sex differences in the pathologic picture of syphilis, 1928
The significance of the association in American medicine, 1928
A silver-starch-gelatin method for demonstration of spirochetes in single tissue sections, 1929
The staining of spirochetes in cover-glass smears by the silver-agar method, 1922
Syphilis of the medium and smaller arteries, 1922
The teaching of physical therapy, 1927
The university medical school and the state, 1920
Virchow's conception of constitutional syphilis, 1926
